Class ItemStorageTracker

java.lang.Object
adris.altoclef.trackers.Tracker
adris.altoclef.trackers.storage.ItemStorageTracker
public class ItemStorageTracker extends Tracker
Access ALL forms of storage.

  • Method Details

    • getItemCount

      public int getItemCount(net.minecraft.item.Item... items)
      Gets the number of items in the player's inventory OR if the player is USING IT in a conversion process (ex. crafting table slots/furnace input, stuff the player is use )

    • getItemCount

      public int getItemCount(ItemTarget... targets)

    • getItemCountScreen

      public int getItemCountScreen(net.minecraft.item.Item... items)
      Gets the number of items visible on the screen in any slot

    • getItemCountInventoryOnly

      public int getItemCountInventoryOnly(net.minecraft.item.Item... items)
      Gets the number of items STRICTLY in the player's inventory. ONLY USE THIS when getting an item is the END GOAL. This will NOT count items in a crafting/furnace slot!

    • getItemCountContainer

      public int getItemCountContainer(net.minecraft.item.Item... items)
      Gets the number of items only in the currently open container, NOT the player's inventory.

    • hasItem

      public boolean hasItem(net.minecraft.item.Item... items)
      Gets whether an item is in the player's inventory OR if the player is USING IT in a conversion process (ex. crafting table slots/furnace input, stuff the player is use )

    • hasItemAll

      Returns whether an item is visible on the screen in any slot

    • hasItemInventoryOnly

      public boolean hasItemInventoryOnly(net.minecraft.item.Item... items)
      Returns whether the player has an item in its inventory ONLY. ONLY USE THIS when getting an item is the END GOAL. This will NOT count items in a crafting/furnace slot!

    • getSlotsWithItemScreen

      public List<Slot> getSlotsWithItemScreen(net.minecraft.item.Item... items)
      Returns all slots containing any item given.

    • getSlotsWithItemContainer

      public List<Slot> getSlotsWithItemContainer(net.minecraft.item.Item... items)
      Returns all slots NOT in the player inventory containing any item given.

    • getSlotsWithItemPlayerInventory

      public List<Slot> getSlotsWithItemPlayerInventory(boolean includeCraftArmorOffhand, net.minecraft.item.Item... items)

    • getItemStacksPlayerInventory

      public List<net.minecraft.item.ItemStack> getItemStacksPlayerInventory(boolean includeCursorSlot)

    • getSlotsThatCanFitInPlayerInventory

      public List<Slot> getSlotsThatCanFitInPlayerInventory(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack, boolean acceptPartial)
      Get all slots in the player's inventory that can fit an item stack.
      Parameters:
      stack - The stack to "fit"/place in the inventory.
      acceptPartial - If true, is OK with fitting PART of the stack. If false, requires 100% of the stack to fit.

    • getSlotThatCanFitInPlayerInventory

      public Optional<Slot> getSlotThatCanFitInPlayerInventory(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack, boolean acceptPartial)

    • getSlotsThatCanFitInOpenContainer

      public List<Slot> getSlotsThatCanFitInOpenContainer(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack, boolean acceptPartial)
      Get all slots in the currently open container that can fit an item stack, EXCLUDING the player inventory.
      Parameters:
      stack - The stack to "fit"/place in the inventory.
      acceptPartial - If true, is OK with fitting PART of the stack. If false, requires 100% of the stack to fit.

    • getSlotThatCanFitInOpenContainer

      public Optional<Slot> getSlotThatCanFitInOpenContainer(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack, boolean acceptPartial)

    • getSlotsThatCanFitScreen

      public List<Slot> getSlotsThatCanFitScreen(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack stack, boolean acceptPartial)
      Get all slots that can fit an item stack.
      Parameters:
      stack - The stack to "fit"/place in the inventory.
      acceptPartial - If true, is OK with fitting PART of the stack. If false, requires 100% of the stack to fit.
